abstract: Unlike many of its larger competitors, Wells Fargo has survived the turmoil in the markets relatively well. Yet the San Francisco bank isn’t likely to pursue its staggering rivals, the firm’s chief executive told The Financial Times.
snippet: Unlike many of its larger competitors, Wells Fargo has survived the turmoil in the markets relatively well. Yet the San Francisco bank isn’t likely to pursue its staggering rivals, the firm’s chief executive told The Financial Times.
lead_paragraph: Unlike many of its larger competitors, Wells Fargo has survived the turmoil in the markets relatively well. Yet the San Francisco bank isn’t likely to pursue its staggering rivals, the firm’s chief executive told The Financial Times.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Chief Says a Bank Deal Isn’t in the Cards
